column1: James Prescott Joule was born at Salford
column2: on Christmas Eve of the year 1818. His father and his grandfather before him were brewers
column5: descended to Mr. Joule and his elder brother
column6: and by them was carried on with success till it was sold
column7: in 1854. Mr. Joule's grandfather came from Elton
column11: and died at the age of fifty-four
column14: married a daughter of John Prescott of Wigan. They had five children
column15: of whom James Prescott Joule was the second
column16: and of whom three were sons--Benjamin
column19: and John--and two daughters--Alice and Mary. Mr. Joule's mother died in 1836 at the age of forty-eight; and his father
column20: who was an invalid for many years before his death
column21: died at the age of seventy-four
